alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 31 at 3:52AM CDT until April 01 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR CIMARRON COUNTY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR CIMARRON COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron. * 20 Foot Winds...Friday. West 30 to 39 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. Saturday. Winds 20 mph. * Relative Humidity...Friday. As low as 5 percent. Saturday. As low as 10 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Friday. 6 to 8. Saturday. 2 to 3. * Timing...Friday. 9 AM through 10 PM. Saturday. 4 PM through 9 PM.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
